title: Mario Aburto Martínez
text: Mario Aburto Martínez (born 8 October 1971) is a Mexican man who was convicted for <a href="assassination">assassinating</a> presidential candidate <a href="Luis%20Donaldo%20Colosio">Luis Donaldo Colosio</a> in 1994. He confessed to the murder and was sentenced to 42 years in prison. Despite the confession and conviction, the "<a href="New%20York%20Times">New York Times</a>" reported that there was widespread belief within Mexico that the conviction involved a conspiracy and coverup mainly by <a href="Carlos%20Salinas%20de%20Gortari">Carlos Salinas de Gortari</a> (the president at that time) and <a href="Manuel%20Camacho%20Sol%C3%ADs">Manuel Camacho Solís</a> (a member of Salinas' <a href="cabinet%20%28government%29">cabinet</a>). A later Mexican film called "Colosio, el asesinato" alleged that the Salinas government was behind the crime.
